result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terry J Halverson in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #14CM591.
Received today, from the Defendant to Judge Carter, requesting information on his case. CC to DA and Atty Kershek.

ADDRESS INFO for Terry J Halverson
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-15-2015)
Prior: 6160 S. 6th Street Los S-12, Milwaukee, WI 53221

Defendant Terry J Halverson in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests a jury status and jury trial date on case #14CM591.  This case to go in to court on status date on that case.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/residence  listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant Terry J Halverson in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
